raw akas.title: How the Hell Am I Normal?

akas: How the Hell Am I Normal? USA (working title)
akas from release info: How the Hell Am I Normal? USA (working title)

1.title: Sixteen Candles
1.plot: It's Adam's 16th birthday, but his parents are too distracted by Barry and Lainey's engagement and Erica's band ambitions to remember their youngest son's big day. But the situation presents an opportunity for Adam to ask Erica to put him on the high school social map. Meanwhile, Beverly thinks she can scare Barry and Lainey straight with the reality of being adults.

2.title: You Got Zuko'd
2.plot: Adam's girlfriend, Jackie, is back after spending her summer at NYU; she has changed so much, it's almost like she's a whole different person. After receiving some not-so-great romantic advice from his loved ones, Adam takes drastic measures to hold on to his relationship. Meanwhile, Beverly is not happy with Lainey's less-than-ideal domestic skills and decides to teach her future daughter-in-law a thing or two.

3.title: RAD!
3.plot: Erica's dreams come true when she lands a job at the new karaoke bar in town; Erica turns to Beverly for help bringing in more customers; Murray tries to teach Barry and Lainey how to be financially responsible adults.

4.title: Hersheypark
4.plot: Adams discovers Brody has been manipulating him; after attending Career Night, Geoff realizes he doesn't want to be an eye doctor like his father.

5.title: Mister Knifey-Hands
5.plot: Despite Beverly's wishes, Jackie's parents allow Adam to watch A Nightmare on Elm Street (1984) and a disagreement between the families ensues; Beverly faces off with horror icon Freddy Krueger; Erica realizes she's not as popular as she once was.

6.title: Fiddler
6.plot: Murray becomes an overzealous stage parent when he learns Adam has no interest in the school production of "Fiddler on the Roof." Meanwhile, Beverly can't seem to keep from interfering with Erica's latest career plan.

7.title: Bohemian Rap City
7.plot: Adam's obsession with toys and the Nickelodeon Super Toy Run contest is cause for concern for Beverly and Murray. Erica has a falling out with Lainey over who gets to sing Bohemian Rhapsody on their audition tape for Star Search.

8.title: The Living Room: A 100 Percent True Story
8.plot: Barry realizes that as a future doctor, he should be more concerned about Murray's health, so he enlists the Jenkintown Posse and Coach Mellor to help get his father in shape.

9.title: Bachelor Party
9.plot: Barry thinks he wants a wild, adult bachelor party, but he realizes Adam's idea of a party to celebrate his brother as a bachelor is more his speed. Beverly surprises Murray with an expensive sports car.

10.title: Yippee Ki Yay Melon Farmer
10.plot: Barry is thrilled that he gets to celebrate Christmas now that he is engaged to Lainey; Murray's brother Marvin makes a promise to Adam with a surprising outcome.

11.title: The Wedding Singer
11.plot: Beverly is in her element as she prepares for Barry and Lainey's wedding; Geoff worries about Adam's shortcomings as a wedding videographer; Barry begins to have second thoughts.

12.title: The Pina Colada Episode
12.plot: Murray and Geoff team up to pull Beverly, Barry and Erica out of their shared misery that Lainey has left town; Coach Mellor prepares for the next step of his life.

13.title: I Coulda Been a Lawyer
13.plot: Beverly decides their street needs another stop sign and pleads her case to the city comptroller; Barry panics when he realizes he's neglected his college applications; Erica struggles with her career choice.

14.title: Major League'd
14.plot: Adam and his friends are recruited to the William Penn Academy baseball team; Barry is in denial about his pitching skills; Geoff's dad interferes in his relationship with Erica.

15.title: My Valentine Boy
15.plot: With Geoff's help, Erica and Valley Erica find a new band member to replace Lainey; Barry convinces Geoff the new band member is trying to steal Erica from him; Adam and Murray each plot to get out of going to Valentine's Day dinner with Beverly.

16.title: There Can Be Only One Highlander Club
16.plot: Despite Beverly wanting the two boys to bond, Adam and Johnny Atkins compete for the head of the Highlander Club at school; Barry tries to ensure that the JTP doesn't fall out of touch after high school.

17.title: The Beverly Goldberg Cookbook
17.plot: Beverly and Adam team up to do a mother-son cooking show on public access television; when Barry ruins the one college letter of recommendation he is able to get, Murray must step in to help.

18.title: Episode #6.18
18.plot:

1.title: The Circle of Driving
1.plot: Under the watchful eye of an eleven-year-old boy's video camera, the Goldbergs face the challenges of life in the 80s, including two new teenage drivers and a grandfather who shouldn't be allowed behind the wheel.

2.title: Daddy Daughter Day
2.plot: A day out with Erica leaves Murray wishing he hadn't asked about her life. Their annual school wardrobe shopping trip leaves Beverly and Adam at odds.

3.title: Mini Murray
3.plot: Barry wants money to buy an expensive pair of basketball shoes, so Murray hires him to work at his furniture store. When Beverly prohibits him from seeing a new horror movie, Adam goes behind her back.

4.title: Why're You Hitting Yourself?
4.plot: As Beverly tries playing matchmaker for Pops, Adam and Barry bond over their discovery of a scrambled porn channel on TV.

5.title: The Ring
5.plot: As Beverly discovers that her engagement ring is the same one Murray gave to his ex-fiancee, Adam looks to a romantic comedy for inspiration as he tries to woo his pretty neighbor.

6.title: Who Are You Going to Telephone?
6.plot: As Adam abandons Pops to go trick-or-treating with a cool new friend, Beverly dons a costume so she can keep Barry from being embarrassed at a Halloween party.

7.title: Call Me When You Get There
7.plot: Barry is thrilled at the freedom offered by his new driver's license, until Beverly lays down her rules of the road. Pops resists wearing a Life Alert necklace and is forced to call Adam when he needs help.

8.title: The Kremps
8.plot: Beverly is determined to make friends with a standoffish neighbor. Barry and Erica battle for control of the family's one telephone line.

9.title: Stop Arguing & Start Thanking
9.plot: As Thanksgiving reignites the longstanding feud between Murray and his ne'er-do-well brother, Marvin, Barry's loss to Adam in a ball game shifts the balance of their sibling rivalry.

10.title: Shopping
10.plot: Erica's (Hayley Orrantia) new job is jeopardized when Beverly (Wendy McLendon-Covey) goes overboard with her employee discount. Pops (George Segal) looks to change Barry's (Troy Gentile) bad luck.

11.title: Kara-Te
11.plot: On the eve of the annual high school talent show, Beverly and Murray square off over Barry's plan to perform his karate routine, while Pops encourages Erica to sing.

12.title: You're Under Foot
12.plot: When Beverly complains that Pops is spending too much time with her at home, she forces Murray to take him back to work at the furniture store. Adam reluctantly gives away his toy collection, hoping it will help him get his first kiss.

13.title: The Other Smother
13.plot: Micromanaging Barry and Erica's college searches pits Beverly against a rival meddling mom. Erica tells Pops that her efforts to enhance her college prospects are based on lies.

14.title: You Opened the Door
14.plot: Beverly chaperons the school dance when, she learns Adam and Dana are attending it together. Murray endures teaching Barry about the birds and the bees.

15.title: Muscles Mirsky
15.plot: While Adam (Sean Giambrone) worries about sexual tension between him and his longtime friend Emmy (guest star Stephanie Katherine Grant), Erica (Hayley Orrantia) and Beverly (Wendi McLendon-Covey) square off over a lack of trust.

16.title: Goldbergs Never Say Die!
16.plot: Barry and Erica join Adam and his friends on a Goonies-inspired treasure hunt for some family jewels misplaced by Pops.

17.title: Lame Gretzky
17.plot: As Murray (Jeff Garlin) struggles to get Adam (Sean Giambrone) interested in hockey, Beverly's (Wendi McLendon-Covey) efforts to help Erica (Hayley Orrantia) prepare for her college entrance exams threaten to backfire.

18.title: For Your Own Good
18.plot: As an unwanted new chair puts Murray (Jeff Garlin) on the warpath with Beverly (Wendi McLendon-Covey), Adam (Sean Giambrone) regrets enlisting Barry's (Troy Gentile) help to fend off a school bully.

19.title: The President's Fitness Test
19.plot: Murray (Jeff Garlin) intervenes when Adam (Sean Giambrone) seeks Beverly's (Wendi McLendon-Covey) help to avoid a national physical fitness test. Barry (Troy Gentile) woos Erica's (Hayley Orrantia) French pen pal (guest star Bella Dayne).

20.title: You're Not Invited
20.plot: To get his little brother his first kiss, Barry hosts a "no parents allowed" birthday party in the basement for Adam - and sparks some surprisingly protective instincts in Erica.

21.title: The Age of Darkness
21.plot: When Erica cannot be consoled after her boyfriend dumps her, Murray steps in to help; Barry becomes obsessed with a new arcade game.

22.title: A Wrestler Called Goldberg
22.plot: Beverly learns that Barry lied about joining the wrestling team; Erica flakes on a promise to take Adam to a local screening of Return of the Jedi.

23.title: Livin' on a Prayer
23.plot: When Murray's high school free throw record is broken, he attends a banquet as the guest of honor. Elsewhere at home, Barry decides to throw a party where he quickly loses the spotlight.

1.title: Love Is a Mix Tape
1.plot: Adam takes the next step in his blossoming relationship with Dana by creating a mix tape for her, but the tape falls into Beverly's hands instead. Elsewhere, Barry gets caught with a fake ID.

2.title: Mama Drama
2.plot: Beverly casts Adam as the star in a rival show when he is not selected to star in his school play; Barry is frustrated that Murray leaves sporting events early.

3.title: The Facts of Bleeping Life
3.plot: Adam and Barry form a garage rock band, and promptly invite Erica and Lainey to join with unforeseen consequences. The royal wedding inspires Bev to renew her vows with Murray.

4.title: Shall We Play a Game?
4.plot: Adam accidentally gets Barry kicked out of a group of cool kids at school; Beverly is upset when she finds out that Erica hangs out with a friend's mother.

5.title: Family Takes Care of Beverly
5.plot: Pops is evicted after accidentally starting a fire in his apartment during a Halloween party.

6.title: Big Baby Ball
6.plot: Beverly gets Mr. Meller fired for singling out Adam during dodgeball, but after some persuading from Adam and Murray she ends up fighting for him to be rehired. Meanwhile, Barry is unable to deal with the fact that Erica is better than him at a new board game called Trivial Pursuit.

7.title: A Goldberg Thanksgiving
7.plot: As Erica resists helping Bev prepare their traditional Thanksgiving dinner, Murray worries that he's losing Adam to his ne'er-do-well brother, Marvin.

8.title: I Rode a Hoverboard!
8.plot: Adam's exaggeration about how he broke his arm could jeopardize his friendship with Emmy Mirsky.

9.title: The Most Handsome Boy on the Planet
9.plot: Barry is excited when a modelling representative approaches him, but Erica thinks it's a scam.

10.title: DannyDonnieJoeyJonJordan
10.plot: Beverly is ordered to clean out the garage by Murray, who wants everything gone except for one trunk that he allows her to keep. Meanwhile, Adam and Barry discover Erica's old collection of New Kids on the Block memorabilia.

11.title: The Darryl Dawkins Dance
11.plot: As the Sadie Hawkins dance approaches, Erica asks Beverly to help her find Barry a date to keep him away from Lainey. But Beverly comes up with a girl that shocks everyone. Meanwhile, Adam gets into a fight with his best friend...Pops.

12.title: Cowboy Country
12.plot: Beverly has trouble accepting Adam deep feelings for Dana; Lainey and Barry convince Murray to watch football with Lainey's dad.

13.title: Van People
13.plot: When Murray takes Erica's car privileges away, Erica and Barry retaliate by buying their own shabby used black van. Meanwhile, Adam gets voted in the yearbook as "nicest guy," which results in a suspension when he objects.

14.title: Barry Goldberg's Day Off
14.plot: Taking inspiration from one of his favorite movies, Barry decides to skip school.

15.title: Happy Mom, Happy Life
15.plot: Dana and Adam are given a doll to parent for a school project, but end up in jeopardy of failing because of Beverly's "grand-smothering." Meanwhile, Erica tries to get back at Barry for monopolizing her best friend's time by joining the JTP, however her plan doesn't go as expected.

16.title: The Lost Boy
16.plot: Adam attends a Phillies game with his dad and ends up lost in the stadium after Murray allows him to leave his seat on his own. Elsewhere, Beverly's guilt trip backfires when Erica and Barry drive off without her during an argument on their way home from the mall.

17.title: The Adam Bomb
17.plot: Adam and Barry get in a prank war, while Erica tries to become a pop star.

18.title: I Drank the Mold!
18.plot: Adam's friend Garry shares his dad's home-brewed beer and gets everyone sick.

19.title: La Biblioteca Es Libros?
19.plot: Beverly arranges for Adam's teacher to tutor him in Spanish, a class she can't believe he's failing; at the same time, Barry gets a job delivering pizzas to impress Murray, but meanwhile, Erica is upset that her father hasn't acknowledged the fact that she has been working throughout her teen years.

20.title: Just Say No
20.plot: Erica tries to educate Beverly about voting; after losing a wrestling match, Barry wants to prove his athletic prowess.

21.title: As You Wish
21.plot: Murray's joy over Adam wanting to play a sport is short-lived once he discovers that it's fencing, and worse yet, he was inspired by a scene from "The Princess Bride." Meanwhile, things don't go exactly as planned when Beverly tries to make a love connection between Barry's wrestling coach and Erica's voice teacher.

22.title: Dance Party USA
22.plot: Adam, thinking Pop's good luck might rub off on him, takes a gamble and ends up losing his beloved toys. Meanwhile, Erica's dream of appearing on a popular TV dance show turns into a nightmare when Barry gives her pink eye.

23.title: Bill/Murray
23.plot: Murray bonds with Lainey's dad and learns what it means to be a true friend.

24.title: Goldbergs Feel Hard
24.plot: Beverly insists on throwing Erica a going away party when she leaves for her summer arts school.

1.title: A Kick-Ass Risky Business Party
1.plot: Lainey, Erica and Barry plan a big party while Lainey's father is out of town; Murray is annoyed by the amount of time Adam spends on the phone talking to Dana.

2.title: A Chorus Lie
2.plot: Adam enlists Beverly's help to combat puberty. Murray tries to inspire Erica to go to the homecoming dance.

3.title: Jimmy 5 Is Alive
3.plot: Murray reluctantly agrees to build a robot with Adam. Barry accidentally tapes over Beverly's treasured video of his 5th birthday party.

4.title: I Caddyshacked the Pool
4.plot: Adam forms a plan to avoid swimming at school -- even though a friendship could be affected. Barry joins the school's Social Awareness Club formed by Erica.

5.title: Boy Barry
5.plot: Murray's mustache ignites a feud between Beverly and his best friend, Bill Lewis. Erica convinces Barry he's lost Lainey to Boy George.

6.title: Couples Costume
6.plot: Adam regrets taking dating advice from Barry and Erica, while Beverly decides to teach him a lesson about the dangers of Halloween after he snubs her for Dana.

7.title: Lucky
7.plot: Barry's dream of having a dog comes true, but he's disappointed when the pup takes an immediate liking to Murray. Beverly is upset she's left out when Erica and Lainey plan a girls-only sleepover.

8.title: In Conclusion, Thanksgiving
8.plot: Beverly insists on hosting a big family gathering for Thanksgiving. Meanwhile, Adam learns he can manipulate Murray with song lyrics, and Barry and Erica compete to be the heir of the Thanksgiving toast.

9.title: Wingmom
9.plot: After Murray agrees to let him join ROTC, Barry asks Beverly to get him out of it. Adam objects when Pops buys a Florida timeshare.

10.title: A Christmas Story
10.plot: Inspired by the Kremps, Beverly creates "Super Hanukkah" to get the family into the holiday spirit. Meanwhile, Adam is annoyed that Barry is more interested in hanging with Lainey than him.

11.title: The Tasty Boys
11.plot: Adam and Barry decide to form a rap supergroup inspired by their mutual love of the Beastie Boys. Jealous of the Kremps' new kitchen, Beverly presses Murray to let her remodel their own.

12.title: Baio and Switch
12.plot: Beverly promises to bring Scott Baio to Jenkintown for Hands Across America causing a war between Barry and Erica as to who gets to hold his hand. Adam seeks dating advice from Pops after he ends up with two dates to the Harvest Hop.

13.title: Double Dare
13.plot: Emmy and Adam audition for Double Dare which is hosting tryouts at their school. Barry convinces Murray that Beverly brings good luck for the Eagles.

14.title: Lainey Loves Lionel
14.plot: Adam is desperate to see Porky's, but Beverly forbids him. Barry wants to do something special for Lainey on Valentines Day, while Erica has to deal with a not-so-secret admirer.

15.title: Weird Al
15.plot: Adam has his heart set on attending the Weird Al concert, while Barry challenges Erica to a counsel-off after they both sign up as peer counselors.

16.title: Edward 'Eddie the Eagle' Edwards
16.plot: Barry gets inspired by Olympic underdog Eddie "the Eagle" Edwards, while Beverly decides that the latest furniture craze is the answer to slumping sales at Murray's store.

17.title: The Dirty Dancing Dance
17.plot: Beverly helps Erica plan a school dance with a "Dirty Dancing" theme, but turns on her daughter once she realizes it may be inappropriate. Meanwhile, Murray and Adam try to become better dancers, without much luck.

18.title: 12 Tapes for a Penny
18.plot: Adam schemes to get as many cassette tapes as possible from a mail-order music club, but when Beverly finds out she points the blame at Erica. Meanwhile, Barry is determined to impress Lainey's dad, even though it's an uphill battle.

19.title: Magic Is Real
19.plot: A heartbroken Adam turns to magic as a means to impress girls. Barry is determined to hang onto his dreams rather than study for the PSAT.

20.title: Dungeons and Dragons, Anyone?
20.plot: Adam's conduct as gym class captain causes a rift with his nerdy friends. Beverly and Murray dash Erica's hopes of attending an out-of-state college when she leaves school.

21.title: Rush
21.plot: While everyone is hot for the band of the week, Erica discovers Canada's progressive rock band, Rush. Barry seeks more attention from their mother after she gives Adam a Best Son award.

22.title: Smother's Day
22.plot: Adam dreams of going to Space Camp. Beverly is upset on Mother's Day when she receives an obviously last-minute gift of "mom coupons" from Barry and Erica.

23.title: Big Orange
23.plot: Beverly and Lainey team up to destroy Barry's favorite t-shirt. Adam reunites the Goldberg Gang Detective Agency to discover what happened to it before Murray can tear down their HQ - the family treehouse.

24.title: Have a Summer
24.plot: Adam and his friends are concerned about Hell Week as new incoming freshmen are hazed by the seniors class. Adam gains respect after body slamming his brother during a school graduation ritual. Meanwhile, Evelyn Silver and her class try to figure out what to put in the schools time capsule.

1.title: Breakfast Club
1.plot: As a new school year begins, the Goldberg kids end up in Saturday detention.

2.title: I Heart Video Dating
2.plot: Erica tries to set Lainey's dad Bill up via video dating and Barry finally chooses a career...to be a gym coach, much to Murray's dismay.

3.title: George! George Glass!
3.plot: Erica and Adam follow the lead of Jan from The Brady Bunch (1969) when dealing with relationship problems. Beverly reaches her limit when it comes to dealing with Murray's stubbornness after he causes her to miss the Beach Boys at Live Aid.

4.title: Crazy Calls
4.plot: Erica and Adam deal with their relationship issues, while Beverly deals with Murray's stubbornness.

5.title: Stefan King
5.plot: Adam tries to be a horror writer in the vein of Stephen King. However, his efforts get him grounded on Halloween when Beverly discovers that she's the basis for the monster in his story. Meanwhile, a desperate Erica forces Barry to be her "date" at the school's costume dance.

6.title: Recipe for Death II: Kiss the Cook
6.plot: Adam makes his own action movie, but an unlikely replacement steps in when Barry goes missing for playing the lead.

7.title: Ho-ly K.I.T.T.
7.plot: Adam gets between Murray and Marvin when they go without him to the Philadelphia Thanksgiving Day parade to see K.I.T.T. from "Knight Rider" in person.

8.title: The Greatest Musical Ever Written
8.plot: A school musical production creates strife between Adam and Barry while substitute teacher Beverly creates havoc in Erica's class on.

9.title: Globetrotters
9.plot: When Adam attends a Globetrotters game, he falls in love with the "theatrics" of the team and tries doing his own tricks on the court. But when he cuts together a video that makes Barry look like he lost a game to Adam and his friends, Barry demands a rematch, culminating in an epic battle at the school gym. Meanwhile, it's Murray's 50th birthday, and, despite his protests, Beverly throws yet another surprise party for him but gets more than she bargained for.

10.title: Han Ukkah Solo
10.plot: After finding out there is only going to be one Hanukkah song in the Holiday Pageant, Beverly convinces Erica to create the perfect song to bring some excitement to the holiday. Erica sees her shot to break into the music business while Barry does his best to prove he too can be a hit maker with music. Meanwhile, Adam's childlike wonder with movies and entertainment is called into question when things he loved as a child aren't as good as he remembers.

11.title: O Captain! My Captain!
11.plot: Barry tries to prove Beverly wrong in his chemistry class while Adam needs Erica's advice for his friendship with Emmy.

12.title: Snow Day
12.plot: Adam and Barry learn something new about Murray while Erica's college application has a surprise for Beverly.

13.title: Agassi
13.plot: Adam attempts to join the tennis club to stay close to a friend; Beverly helps Erica go through her post-breakup depression.

14.title: The Spencer's Gift
14.plot: Erica and Barry get jobs at Spencer's Gifts, then Murray insists that Adam get a job as well, but Beverly is adamant that Adam focus on filmmaking.

15.title: So Swayze It's Crazy
15.plot: Beverly's on a mission to make Adam a film star.

16.title: The Kara-te Kid
16.plot: The ultimate karate battle between the Adams.

17.title: Deadheads
17.plot: Barry's JTP membership is in jeopardy while a family swear jar is introduced.

18.title: Baré
18.plot: College decisions for Barry, Erica, and Lainey.

19.title: A Night to Remember
19.plot: Barry plans big romantic gestures for Lainey on prom night; Adam is thrilled when a nerdy but cute junior asks him out.

20.title: The Dynamic Duo
20.plot: Adam and Pops debate the newest Batman film while Erica goes on a college interview.

21.title: Fonzie Scheme
21.plot: Beverly's attempts to find Murray a hobby backfire; Erica comes to the rescue when Barry's scheme to steal golf carts goes awry.

22.title: The Day After the Day After
22.plot: A TV movie freaks out Barry while Erica and Adam use mother's day gifts to get what they want.

23.title: Jedi Master Adam Skywalker
23.plot: Erica and Barry's curiosity with the yearbook's best goes awry.

24.title: Graduation Day
24.plot: When Erica realizes how much Beverly's love means to her, she tries to delay graduating so she can stay with her; Barry's plans for Lainey and himself fall apart; Dana makes a surprise visit as Adam and Jackie officially become a couple.

1.title: Weird Science
1.plot: Erica is off to college while Barry is in search of a new girlfriend.

2.title: Hogan Is My Grandfather
2.plot: Adam's school project about Pops backfires while Beverly teaches an important lesson to Erica and Barry.

3.title: Goldberg On The Goldbergs
3.plot: Beverly confronts Coach Mellor who reveals his strained relationship with his brother then Adam and Barry join in after a fight breaks out. Beverly sees that this could be Adam and Barry as adults. Meanwhile, Geoff and Erica struggle with their relationship being long distance.

4.title: Revenge O' The Nerds
4.plot: Beverly tries to reinvent herself in more than one way, while Erica asks for Adam's help at college.

5.title: Jackie Likes Star Trek
5.plot: Adam and Jackie disagree on whether to dress up as Star Wars or Star Trek characters for Halloween. Murray tests if agreeing with your spouse on everything saves the relationship. Barry uses the Ouija board to make up with his girl.

6.title: Girl Talk
6.plot: Adam and Marvin help Murray as the store faces competition, while Beverly assists Barry as he courts a girl at school.

7.title: A Wall Street Thanksgiving
7.plot: Uncle Marvin returns with a proposition for the family, while Beverly's plans for Thanksgiving dinner goes awry.

8.title: The Circle Of Driving Again
8.plot: Murray teaches Adam to drive, while Erica needs help with her social life at school.

9.title: Parents Just Don't Understand
9.plot: A song written by Adam and Barry doesn't get the accolades they hoped for, while Erica needs distance from Beverly.

10.title: We Didn't Start the Fire
10.plot: The battle for the best Hanukkah party begins.

11.title: The Goldberg Girls
11.plot: Beverly creates her own mom group, while Erica reaches a breaking point with Geoff.

12.title: Dinner With The Goldbergs
12.plot: Geoff joins the family out for Erica's birthday dinner.

13.title: The Hooters
13.plot: Adam's actions almost injure his woodshop teacher, while Beverly and Geoff want to be cultured like Erica.

14.title: Hail Barry
14.plot: Barry joins the football team but is quickly benched by Coach Mellor due to his lack of playing ability. He convinces himself the coach is testing him; but when Barry realizes the truth of his playing ability, Adam helps his brother understand there are other ways he can contribute to the team and comes up with their own version of the Super Bowl Shuffle. Meanwhile, Beverly designs jackets that she tries to get Murray and Erica to sell when a national TV channel won't.

15.title: Adam Spielberg
15.plot: Adam loves director Steven Spielberg so much and decides to film an original script he wrote about Indiana Jones and his passion for directing is called into question. Meanwhile, Murray and Barry make a bet about whether or not a cheesesteak sandwich in New Jersey is the best one ever.

16.title: The Scrunchie Rule
16.plot: When Beverly gets a glimpse into a soon-to-be empty nest, she replaces her kids with the Mellor brothers, nursing Coach Mellor back to health after falling off the rope climb. Meanwhile, Erica and her college roommate get on each other's nerves in their dorm room, especially when Valley Erica puts a scrunchie on the door and kicks Erica out.

17.title: Colors
17.plot: Barry enlists the JTP to help him break up Beverly's group of friends so Barry can have all the attention but soon realizes he made a major mistake when Beverly gets into a fight with her friends. Meanwhile, Adam's attempts to trick Murray into loving theater backfire.

18.title: MTV Spring Break
18.plot: Hoping to get the true spring break experience, Erica and Barry visit Pops in Florida, yet it's nothing how they expected. Meanwhile, Adam tells the truth to Beverly and Murray but then gets a surprising reaction

19.title: Flashy Little Flashdancer
19.plot: The family doesn't support Beverly when she decides to take up dance with the Frentas; when Emmy starts dating a cool guy, Adam thinks their friendship is in jeopardy.

20.title: The Opportunity of a Lifetime
20.plot: Barry gets the chance to throw the first pitch at a Philadelphia Phillies game and believes this is his chance to play professionally, but it's anything but. Meanwhile, Erica makes an important decision about her future in college.

21.title: Spaceballs
21.plot: Adam tries to start a Mel Brooks club after he sees the movie "Spaceballs," and Jackie mistakes his club advertisement for political satire and puts it in the school paper. Meanwhile, when Beverly and Pops come up for parents weekend at school, Erica plans on telling them an important decision she

22.title: Let's Val Kilmer This Car
22.plot: When Lainey moves back to town, Barry asks her to the prom; Erica tells Murray she has made a final decision about her future in college.

-1.title: 1990-Something
-1.plot: Now head of school Glascott tries to figure out how to educate his students which include his sister's two precocious teenage daughters.

locations: Sony Pictures Studios - 10202 W. Washington Blvd., Culver City, California, USA
3071 Earlmar Drive, Cheviot Hills, Los Angeles, California, USA::(Goldberg family home - exteriors)
imdb.title: The Goldbergs
plot: This ABC show takes place in Jenkintown, Pennsylvania in the 1980s and follows the lives of a family named _The Goldbergs_ (qv).::Abby
